title: How to Make a Druzy Pendant

steps.headline: Choose your bezel.
steps.description: A bezel is a pendant with an open center that you can fill with your druzy stone ingredients. You can purchase one in a craft store or online. Bezels come in many different shapes and colors. For example, you can get a bezel that is shaped like a circle, oval, heart, or square. You can also find bezels in copper, gold, silver, black, and other finishes.

steps.headline: Select your glitter.
steps.description: You will need to have some coarse glitter and some fine glitter to make a druzy pendant. Mixing the two types of glitter together will help to produce the stone-like texture for your druzy pendant. Choose two different colors of glitter to mix together. This will give your druzy pendant some dimension. For example, you could try black and purple together or blue and gold together. Experiment to find a combination you like.

steps.headline: Get some Mod Podge.
steps.description: Mod Podge is a type of glue that dries clear and that will bind together your glitter. The combination of the Mod Podge and glitter will form a stone-like pendant. You can find Mod Podge in most craft supply stores.

steps.headline: Find a toothpick.
steps.description: You will need a toothpick to stir the glitter and Mod Podge together. A toothpick is ideal because it is small enough to get into the curves and corners of your bezel.

steps.headline: Lay out paper towels.
steps.description: Since you will be working with glue and glitter, laying out some paper towels is a good idea. They will protect your work surface and make it easier to clean up when you are done.

steps.headline: Pour Mod Podge into the bezel.
steps.description: You will need to fill the bezel about halfway with the Mod Podge. Slowly pour the Mod Podge into the well of your bezel, making sure that you do not get it on the edges of the bezel. Use a paper towel to wipe away any Mod Podge that gets onto the edges of your bezel.

steps.headline: Add some glitter and stir.
steps.description: Next, add the glitter on top of the Mod Podge and stir the glitter into the Mod Podge with the toothpick. You will need to add about the same amount of glitter as Mod Podge, but it is okay to add a small amount at a time.

steps.headline: Keep adding glitter and stirring until the mixture looks like wet sand.
steps.description: You want your mixture of glitter and Mod Podge to look like wet sand. When it reaches this consistency, you can work on perfecting the shape of the faux stone. Try to shape it so that the surface looks natural and rocky. However, keep in mind that it does not need to be perfect.

steps.headline: Dust on a bit more glitter and poke into place with the toothpick.
steps.description: To add some extra shimmer on top of the druzy stone, sprinkle a bit of glitter on top of it. Then, poke the glitter into place using the toothpick until you are happy with the way it looks.

steps.headline: Let the pendant dry overnight.
steps.description: Place your pendant on an even surface and leave it to dry overnight. If the pendant has a loop at the top of it that causes the pendant to sit at an angle, then place the pendant on the edge of a table or other flat surface so that the pendant loop is hanging off the edge. This will help to ensure that the glitter and Mod Podge mixture will be even in the bezel. Make sure that the pendant is out of reach of pets and small children. After the pendant has dried completely, you can place it on a chain and wear it!
